intro: Isotrema malacophyllum, commonly known as the Malacophyllum fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
